NotWhitelisted().details: Thrown when a non-whitelisted contract attempts to access a whitelist-only function.

Unauthorized().details: Thrown when anyone but a whitelist admin tries to call an admin function.

UnauthorizedER().details: Thrown when anyone but a whitelist admin tries to call an admin function.

acceptAdmin().details: Accepts the role as admin. This function reverts if the caller is not the new pending admin.

addToWhitelist(address).details: Adds an contract to the whitelist.

params.account: the contract to add to the whitelist.

params.amount: The amount of tokens to claim.
params.recipient: The address which will receive the claimed tokens.

deposit(uint256,address).details: Deposits tokens to be exchanged into an account.

params.amount: The amount of tokens to deposit.
params.owner: The owner of the account to deposit the tokens into.

params.amount: The amount of tokens to exchange.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

removeFromWhitelist(address).details: Adds an contract to the whitelist.

params.account: the contract to remove from the whitelist.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

setPendingAdmin(address).details: Sets the pending admin. This function reverts if the new pending admin is the zero address or the caller is not the current admin. This is to prevent the contract admin being set to the zero address which would deadlock privileged contract functionality.

withdraw(uint256,address).details: Withdraws tokens from the caller's account that were previously deposited to be exchanged.

params.amount: The amount of tokens to withdraw.
params.recipient: The address which will receive the withdrawn tokens.

ADMIN.details: The identifier of the role which maintains other roles.

SENTINEL.details: The identitifer of the sentinel role

accounts.details: A mapping specifying all of the accounts.

buffer.details: the source of the exchanged collateral

syntheticToken.details: the synthetic token to be transmuted

totalBuffered.details: The total amount of tokens which are in the auxiliary buffer.

totalUnexchanged.details: The total amount of unexchanged tokens which are held by all accounts.

underlyingToken.details: the underlying token to be recieved

userdoc.notice: A contract which facilitates the exchange of synthetic assets for their underlying
